p: For both rainfall scenarios, the effect of AM fungi on nutrient losses was tracked after every simulated rainfall across the experimental period (Fig. S3). The presence of AM fungi consistently decreased mineral P losses for both rain treatments (Fig. S3). However, the impact of AM fungi on N loss varied throughout the experiment: in the first growth period mycorrhizal fungi decreased N loss, whereas the effect was inversed during the second growth period, where the presence of AM fungi stimulates total mineral N loss (Fig. S3, Table 1). The later was probably due to N‐release from N‐fixing legumes, which were much more abundant in the treatment with AM fungi (see the next section).
